@Vaerospace: If I understand how zeronet works correctly it's very much like #Bitcoin, and all the other social media systems are basically now altcoins of Zeronet. What truly distinguishes Bitcoin from others is It's high level of decentralisation and censorship resistance. Politics doesn't matter, greed doesn't matter, cleverness doesn't matter. Except as it serves the best interest of Bitcoin. Whose sole interest is the safety, security and value of the owners and users of Bitcoin. Likewise zeronet doesn't care about your politics, your greed or your cleverness. All zeronet cares about is protecting the value (free speech) of the owners and users of zeronet. Bitcoin adoption is still relatively small, though it's market cap is around a hundred billion!!! Zeronet is doing the same thing. Both #Zeronet and Bitcoin are something truly new. It will take awhile before others truly catch on. But they will. In the meantime both will continue to grow and improve the user experience and value..üëçüòÄ

I've been trying to test and aggressively use the Android app in single user and multiuser modes. At first I had a lot of problems with SD corruption leading to boot loops. This usually required wiping my SD, formatting and re-partitioning my SD card. Pretty simple process with a custom recovery like TWRP.  It turned out that the big problem with drive corruption seems to be not exiting zeronet gracefully. But I found a way to exit gracefully in both single user and multiuser modes. In both single and multiuser modes you can use the normal  exit on the ZeroHello page. If you can't see the normal exit with your Android browser temporarily switch your browser to desktop mode. Then you will be able to see the normal exit. In multi user mode you can only exit with the account or identity you established in single user mode. Now I can exit zeronet gracefully in both modes. As a result zeronet app has been very smooth and stable, without corruption..üëçüòÄ

@Vaerospace: the information is for anyone it might help. The drive corruption may be a problem or limitation of SD cards, and not even be a problem with the #Zeronet app. Because Android zeronet seems very stable now. As long as I only exit gracefully..üëçüòÄ
@Nofish see me below, just so the right people know..üëçüòÄ

@Vaerospace: If you don't exist gracefully it will corrupt your drive and cause a boot loop. It's still beta. But if they can handle installing a custom recovery like TWRP and backup. Then they should be ok. If not, android Zeronet app is not ready for them yet..üëç

There's not going to be any Fucking! world war. You can't have a world war with today's nuclear weapons. It would ignite the atmosphere and burn off all the oxygen. Planes and birds would fall from the sky. Including Air Force One. Total annihilation in seconds.

There is an excellent program that does this called Retroshare. Very polished and has continued to develop and improve. It's extremely private and very powerful. It's fiend TO friend and friends OF friends. So you basically already need a friend to connect with. They have created a Tor version to make it easier to make friends with STRANGERS! :) Retroshare is also highly censorship immune.. You can also do what you want with Zeronet, and create your own Zite aka site. You can in fact create your own FB etc.. It will be a while before people fully grasp the power of Zeronet. Bitcoin is like this, even at around a 100 billion market cap lol. Retroshare and Zeronet need full power stable smartphone apps. But they are getting there. I want to also experiment with Linux Deploy on android. Both Retroshare and Zeronet have good Linux versions. :-) p.s. And don't forget about Freenet. It also runs under Linux. So many possibilities. So much progress. So much fun, exciting! :-)
